noun.description: A threatened penalty for disobeying a law or rule.
examples: a range of sanctions aimed at deterring insider abuse

noun.description: Official permission or approval for an action.
examples: he appealed to the bishop for his sanction

verb.description: Give official permission or approval for (an action)
examples: only two treatments have been sanctioned by the Food and Drug Administration

verb.description: Impose a sanction or penalty on.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun denoting an ecclesiastical decree): from French, from Latin sanctio(n-), from sancire ratify. The verb dates from the late 18th century.
